title: ICE: "Type parameter out of range when substituting in region 'a"

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
## Code

``` rust
use std::borrow::Borrow;

fn double_borrow<'a, B1, B2 = &'a i32>(_n: B1)
    where B1: 'a + Borrow<B2>, B2: 'a + Borrow<i32>
{
}

fn main() {
    double_borrow(&52);
}
```

([Playpen link](http://is.gd/VRHe6n))

Here's some things I noticed when writing this example:
- The function in question has to be used (having an empty `main` wouldn't cause an ICE)
- Explicitly specifying the generic parameters prevents the ICE (e.g. `double_borrow::<&i32, &i32>(&52)`)
- At least one of the generic type parameters has to be bound to the lifetime `'a` (in the above example, it doesn't matter if it's `B1` or `B2`)
- `B2` has to have a default type parameter
## Output

```
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc --verbose double_borrow.rs
double_borrow.rs:9:5: 9:18 error: internal compiler error: Type parameter out of range when substituting in region 'a (root type=Some(&'a i32)) (space=FnSpace, index=0)
double_borrow.rs:9     double_borrow(&52);
                       ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
```

## Version

```
$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.5.0-dev (b0f440163 2015-10-28)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: b0f440163024a5d7f8f3629640dc423c96747d69
commit-date: 2015-10-28
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.5.0-dev
```

(My rustc is a bit outdated, but this ICE is present on stable, beta, and nightly in the playpen)
